non_residential_details.development_type: Change of Use with Extension(s) over 999sqm

description: Redevelopment and single and two storey extensions of C2 hostel increasing existing building footprint by 327sqm and gross internal floor space by 1,566sqm. Development works to include: formation of Community Hub (Class D2); construction of a second storey; internal configuration; formation of additional 28 self-contained units (total 60 self-contained units and 217 beds up from 85 beds), vehicle and cycle parking, refuse and recycling store, boundary fencing, walling and landscape enhancements (Regulation 3 - Council's own development).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Drawings: 5965/E/001, 5965/E/002 Rev. A, 5965/E/003 Rev. A, 5965/E/004 Rev. A, 5965/E/005 Rev. A, 5965/E/006 Rev. A, 5965/P/002, 5965/P/003, 5965/P/004, 5965/P/005, 5965/P/006, 001 Rev a (including Tree Schedule from Wharton Arboriculture Ltd), received 24/12/2014, 5965/P/001 Rev. E, received 30/11/2015. Design & Access Statement dated December 2014, received 24/12/2014, Energy Statement by Energy Council, BREEAM Pre-Assessment by Energy Council dated 19/06/2015, Transport and Travel Plan Statement by Amec Foster Wheeler Environment & Infrastructure UK Limited (additional/revised info received from John Hayland on 24/12/2015.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | Prior to the commencement of the development, details of a site construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The submission shall include the following:  a.	Details of the number of on-site construction workers and of the transport options for them; b.	anticipated route, anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site per day; c.	delivery times and booking system; d.	route and location of site access for construction traffic and associated signage based on the construction vehicle access and egress routes; e.	management of consolidated or re-timed trips; f.	an Air Quality Dust Management Plan that includes an Air Quality (Dust) Risk Assessment and details of noise/vibration mitigation measures and monitoring arrangements for noise, vibration and dust by suitably qualified noise and air quality specialists.  Noise / vibration and dust mitigation measures must accord with the Mayor's SPG 'The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition ' (2014); BS 5228 Parts 1 & 2; the Institute of Air Quality Management 'Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction'; g.	details of site security and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate; h.	secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities; i.	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear and including details of any temporary vehicle access points; j.	details of the location for storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices; k.	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from members of the public; l.	measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools (including Gifford Primary School) with regard  to delivery times and necessary diversions; m.	details of all pedestrian and cyclist diversions; n.	a commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme; and o.	confirmation of use of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar.   Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties within or surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that appropriate mitigation measures are put in place to protect the amenity of local residents that live in close proximity to the demolition and construction site and to ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); (Interim) SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); the Greater London Authority SPG 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition' (2014), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The trees, shrubs and hedgerows as set out on drawings 5965/P/001 Rev. E, received 24/12/2015 shall be retained as part of the development. The trees shall be fully protected in accordance with a Tree Protection Plan ** in accordance with BS5837* to be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.    All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Tree protection Plan shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works associated with that approved development have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.   *Using the most recent revision the of the Standard ** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)  Reason: Details of the Tree Protection Plan and a programme of monitoring the tree works are required prior to the commencement of any site preparation works because such works would carry a high risk of damaging trees and other vegetation particularly by site operatives that are not experienced to carry out works around trees. The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. The tree protection measures shall be retained throughout the demolition of existing buildings and construction of the approved development, in accordance with the recommendations in BS5837 (2012). | Hard and soft landscaping (including shared surface treatments), the equipped play areas and boundary treatments that are detailed within the approved Design and Access Statement and illustrated on drawings ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E, received 30/12/2015, shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved to which the landscaping, equipped play areas and boundary treatments form part. Any alteration or change from the approved details shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the implementation of the relevant works.    All soft landscaping shall be carried out in the earliest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive). The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions and BS8545:2014 Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape.  Any trees that within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting, that die, are removed, uprooted, are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved.   The approved landscaping, play areas and boundary treatments shall be retained thereafter and maintained in perpetuity.    Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the positive visual character and appearance of the area; to ensure that the necessary boundary treatments are incorporated into the development in the interests of meeting the Secured by Design principles; in order to ensure that the site landscaping is provided in a timely fashion; and in order to provide a good level of privacy for future occupants, in accordance with policies LV2.18, LV7.3, LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); policies 2.18, 7.4, 7.13, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1(h) and (i), 2.10, 5.3, 5.4 and 6.3 of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The 13 nos. car parking spaces (including disabled car parking spaces) shown on the approved plan reference (Ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E), received 30/12/2015, shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the unit hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | The active charging points for electric vehicles shown on the approved drawing (Ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E), received 30/12/2015, shall be provided with passive charging provision prior to the first occupation of the development, unless an alternative work phasing strategy for the installation of the electric vehicle charging points is approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The installed facility and related space shall be retained permanently thereafter.   Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and  policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Sound limiting insulation shall be installed between the approved community space and communal eating area and the adjoining self-contained units to the side and self-contained unit above prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development, to achieve an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq, 5mins (octaves) or NR 20 Leq, 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom, and NR 30 Leq, 5mins (octaves) or NR 25 Leq, 5mins (one-third octaves) inside a habitable room when noise is generated from the non-residential uses and the sound limiting insulation shall be retained thereafter.   Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers of the residential units located above the approved community floorspace and nursery, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The kitchen located within the development hereby approved shall only be fitted out with equipment for warming food, and no cooking facilities that necessitate the installation of extract equipment shall be provided unless separate planning permission is first obtained for the installation of the extract equipment (where required).  Reason: To protect residents from odours from cooking, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The approved community space shall only operate during the hours of 0700 - 2200 on weekdays and Saturday, and 0900 - 2200 on Sunday and Public Holidays.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers of the residential units located in close proximity to the approved community space, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | The rating noise level emitted from any proposed plant and machinery within the development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of amenity is provided for occupiers / users of the residential, education and community buildings, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2015; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Notwithstanding the information submitted in support of the application, prior to the commencement of the development other than site preparation, remediation and / or the formation of accesses, a report, which includes full details and drawings of the sustainability/energy measures that are to be incorporated into both refurbished and extended elements of the development, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 35%.   In demonstrating compliance with this percentage reduction the applicant should consider the use of measures in line with the Energy Hierarchy including the incorporation of on-site renewables.  This reduction should be calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations whilst carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be also included and measures to reduce them should be demonstrated. Provision should also be made to monitor the output of any low and/or renewable installations.  Within three-months of the first occupation of the development, Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.  Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2015 (with FALP 2011/REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.  Reason:  To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2015, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013). | The approved new element (extended) of the development shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM overall Excellent standard (based on the latest BREEAM Technical Guidance).   1. Within three months of the commencement of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the latest BREEAM New Construction Scheme and Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.  2. Within 3 months from the date of first occupation, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.  Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.      Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | The building shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Building Research Establishment BREEAM domestic refurbishment rating of Excellent (based on latest Technical Guidance). No development shall commence until   1.	Within 3 months of commencement of the refurbished element of the development, evidence that the development is registered with the Building Research Establishment (BRE) under the BREEAM domestic refurbishment scheme and Interim Design Stage Assessment and Certificates verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.   2.	Within 3 months from the date of first occupation of the refurbished element of the development a Post Refurbishment Stage Assessment and Certificate verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been achieved.   Following any approval of a 'Post Refurbishment Stage' assessment and certificates of each element of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM domestic refurbishment Excellent standard shall be retained in working order in perpetuity.   Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(g) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policy 5.2(H) of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The biodiversity (green and brown) roofs shall be laid out in accordance with the details shown on approved drawing Drawing ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E  and Section 3.9 of the approved Design and Access Statement unless an alternative scheme for the provision of biodiversity roofs is submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works. The detailed design of the biodiversity roofs shall incorporate the following:  a.	Be biodiversity based with extensive substrate base (depth 80-150mm);  b.	Have sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting, including the re-use of any demolition material where feasible; c.	Be planted / seeded with a mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum; d.	Have relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.  The biodiversity roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair. The biodiversity roofs shall be retained thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan (2015); policies 1.1(j), (k) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); and policies LV5.10 and LV5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Details of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the development. The details shall, as far as possible, accord with the indicative details of facing materials set out at Sections 3.5 and 3.5 of the approved Design and Access Statement and on the approved drawings. The details and samples of materials shall include:  a.	brickwork (including brick bond, brick panels and mortar courses); b.	cladding materials (including roof finishes); c.	all window treatments (including drawing to 1:20 scale showing details of the window recess, and details of window certification for Secured by Design); d.	building entrances (including details of door certification for Secured by Design); e.	privacy screen treatment;  f.	refuse and bicycle store entrance doors, ventilation louvres, screening (including details of door certification for Secured by Design);  g.	details of the design of any residential letterboxes (including confirmation that the letterboxes meet PAS 24:2012 or other relevant standard);  h.	any other materials to be used.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are of a high-quality specification and make a positive contribution to the townscape, in accordance with policy 7B of Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015). | The cycle storage spaces shown on the approved drawing (Ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E), received 30/12/2015, shall be used to provide cycle storage for the development based on Table 6.3 'Cycle Parking minimum standards' of the London Plan (2015). The cycle storage facilities shall be ready to use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and retained free of obstruction permanently thereafter.   Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG. | The dedicated refuse and recycling enclosures for the approved development shown on the approved drawing ref: Ref: 5965/P/001 Rev. E), received 30/12/2015 and at Section 3.8 of the approved Design and Access Statement shall be provided prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.   Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); and (Interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities. | The 3 wheelchair self-contained units as indicated on the approved plans, shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(3) (Wheelchair user dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, or other such relevant technical standards in use at the time of the construction of the development.  Reason: To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing in a timely fashion that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide an appropriate choice and housing opportunity for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with the objectives of policies: 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan (2015); and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, a comprehensive Delivery and Servicing Plan for the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall cover the following:  "	Traffic routing "	Restriction on size and number of HGV deliveries/movements per day        "	Deliveries and collections "	Servicing trips (including maintenance) "	Cleaning and waste removal "	Control of vehicle movements within the site "	Management and security of disabled parking "	Monitoring and review of operations  The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety and the amenity of surrounding residents, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015) and Local Variation policies 6.13, 7A and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding any details submitted with this application, the upper floor side (east and west elevations) windows in the development hereby approved and within ten (10) metres of the boundaries of Nos. 5 - 13 Larwood Close and Nos. 3 - 7 Matthews Road shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless opening part is 1.7 meters above internal finished floor level and thereafter retained as such.  Reason: In the interest of protecting the amenity of prospective occupiers of the dwelling and neighbouring sites, in accordance with policy 7.6 of the Consolidated  London Plan 2015, policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the Travel Plan submitted, a revised Travel Plan, designed to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The revised Travel Plan should include trip numbers rather than percentages, preferably daily trip rates from the development incorporating trip rates and nodal split for the community centre. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented at the first use of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained in operation thereafter.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety accordance with policies 1.1 f & 2.8 g of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.1, 6.9, 6.10, 6.11, & 6.12 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
